thread.title: Leading trainer banned for nine months
thread.title_full: Leading trainer banned for nine months

title: Leading trainer banned for nine months
text:
Magic Millions winning trainer Darryl Hansen disqualified for nine months Nathan Exelby The Courier-Mail Magic Millions winning trainer Darryl Hansen disqualified for nine months Nathan Exelby The Courier-Mail Darryl Hansen has been banned for nine months after an elevated carbon dioxide reading for a horse in his stable. Picture: Luke Marsden. 
MAGIC Millions winning trainer Darryl Hansen has been disqualified for nine months over an elevated carbon dioxide (TCO2) reading for a horse in his stable. 
Hansen pleaded not guilty to the charge of presenting How Can I Help with an elevated carbon dioxide (TCO2) reading after an unplaced run at Ipswich on August 18. 
Hansen, who trained Le Chef to win this year’s $2 million Magic Millions 2YO Classic, will appeal to the independent Racing Disciplinary Board, his legal counsel Matthew Tutt told couriermail.com.au. Hansen trained Le Chef to Magic Millions glory this year. Picture: Mike Batterham 
The Sunshine Coast trainer will seek a stay of proceedings in his application for an appeal which must be lodged within five days, Tutt said. 
Deputy steward Daniel Aurisch said the disqualification period would start on October 26. 
“We took into account this is his fifth offence under the same rule,’’ Aurisch said. Other Stories
